אחד מבני עליה יקר תפארת רום המעלות במעלות תהלות השלמות

London 6 Greatalie St.

Goodmansfield

14th Feb 1851. 12th Adar 5611

Revd. & Dear Sir,

I became quite disappointed on Monday last when the American letters were delivered and none for me, but this disappointment was soon settled on the Tuesday when your 28th Shebat was sent to me by so me unknown person, notwithstanding זיכה וזוכה את הרבים באור תורתו וחכמתו רועה אמונה כבודי I loose no time to reply as your case is at heart וידיד נפשי החכם הכולל הרבני המושלם כמה"ר יצחק (בן אורי ז"ל) יל"ו of my pure sincerity and zeal, for there was one only (whom I knew) in the field my own dear nephew when I first wrote to you, still ה' את ברכתו ויזרח יצח"ק בארץ ההיא זר"א רב על אויביו יתגבר וכ"ל on behalf of a man of your high value in the literary world, not once, twice, or trice, did I express it by writing to my friends in Abrahams of N: York, אשר הוא עושה ה' בידו יצליח אנפ"ו that notwithstanding all the Revd you have imported from England & other parts ? Revd Drs ברכתי הטוב והמטיב and Isaac Leeser עדי בשמים ושהדי במרומים מראשית let us then consider the number of years לא נשלחתי מני איש וקנוא קנאתי קנאת ה" לכאוב what shall I denominate your opponents there לשעבר I am quite surprised of Mr. Harts conduct towards you and myself as well, as he might have had the common civility of acknowledging my important letter even should he be not desirous of interfering; you say unless “I was charged with keeping the subject a secret.” No— I shall say to you אם יהיו בכף א', you should in confidence know all but to this day בכף שניה מכריע את כלם I shall address him a few lines which you will be pleased to seal Now for business—I am fully persuaded of your honor & integrity, I am never afraid of what I write, but where I am friendly to a person I do not wish him to have the least surmise of my being the author, for it is only meant as information to an honorable friend as yourself. therefore if my name is not mentioned in any way I care not—so whatever I am to state to you let it be in the most secrecy and confidence. At last Mr. Morais opened his mind to me this 10 days past, which I really was surprised at his behavior of not giving me the least information before, or taking my advice, all the place and every one knowing it after the pretended friendship and my corresponding it, moreso as he was reccomended to me from his master when he first came here and he being ? convinced that my behavior to him was as a father—however he has full cleared himself and he is not in the least culpable since he could not say any thing about it

about it until he had a reply, it is about a fortnight (that is after 3 months) he recd a letter from Mr. H. stating all the particulars and the duties, and he might take his chance which letter he read part to me, and that made him then take the resolution to go, he is now preparing and I am almost sure that some part last week or beginning of the one after he sets off to steam to his destiny, it something surprised me Mr. H: letter wherein he says that they do not require regular lectures but as they have been accustomed by the lost חזן they expect him occasionally to give one or something like it—it was on that point which caused me to write to you in my last concerning him, for after you deliverd sermons in that place which the whole world must confess that you are almost שמעו נא המורים or המור"ים שמעו נא without any flattery, how could they reconcile to hear from a foreign gangman? who is just learning the language and above all has not the least notion of lecturing nor he assumes it, he has lectured 3 or 4 times in the school as an attempt who is the author of them? That is better known! the method how he came to apply for the situation he acquainted me was thus, a Female a Mrs Levi from your place was on המכסה אני מאברהם at our synagogue and heard Mr. M. make some תשוב"ה לא זכיתי להיות בעל which the schoolmasters perform. She sent for him the day after and said if he would allow her she would obtain him the situation she would write as she thought he would do, and ? that she was fully commissioned to look out for one, he and her managed the affair for some time secretly—but his finding no immediate answer of his being accepted, things came out and public, when I heard of such a female being here, I took the opportunity of calling upon her with my card and presented her with one of my sermons. I was so eager to serve you that I wished to know how matters stood and if there were no ways or method of reconciling affairs with such a great man as Leeser, she received me in such a way, replied so short and abruptly, far from a Lady, therefore I styled her to you a Female, I quitted and never returned, than I resolved to write so far how affairs stood. I have not nor shall fail to speak to Mr. M since he has behaved friendly as it was his duty so to do; to hesitate & give him the full description of the congregation, but you must know that he flatters himself safe and sure to be elected as he hears there are only 2 Germans who are candidates and he stands the best chance with them, as he has a strong voice—not harmonious nor musical, he has a very poor family at Leghorn (my country) he wants to do the best for them that is his object, he is a good hebrew teacher for beginers such as the Bible & translation & grammar and God only knows how all this may suit your congregation and his sermons should be ordered to treat on a particular point. I think I have given you a full account and information of all particulars. I believe Mr. M would succeed and do well in a school if there are no other masters there competent to teach hebrew Grammar. I did not hesitate to mention it to Mr DeSolla that which you stated, his reply was, “if you examine dates you will find that you had already given it up,” so your complaint must fall with the other candidates as well.” I shall not fail of writing my nephews my sentiments—no one should have been too hasty about it after the number of years you served the congregation חזן you will excuse my troubling you with such

a long letter but perhaps all the information may be of some use to you, but earnestly reccomending confidence as M is a good young man and friend. Again let me intreat you to give in a little, reconcile matters, dont let it be said יחיד give in in that which may be consistent we are all over and in all places יום כפור I trust that you will hearken to my humble השכמות ומי שבירך and I shall have the felicity to hear that by such all is peace, it afforded me much satisfaction to read in this days Chronicle of the resolution of the 13th January in your praise. Sir Moses at present he is for moments here but as soon (which will be very shortly) as he remains in town for a day or two I shall forward your literary undertaking and in any other way I can serve you command the באמת ובאמונה—pray please in your reply to explain two points which I did not rightly understand wherein you say such as speaking of my manner of reading the service.” and the passage you say “His intention to apply were made known through other channel.” favour me with a little ששו כל אויבי שמעו רעתי I fully expect your answer in full and how matters stand I do not care for Postage or expence to serve a friend—it is rather strange that Mr. H is not very punctual to reply: M: told me it was many and many weeks. he talks of going to Liverpool next Thursday

I wish you every success may you prosper and all your opponents conquer.

בדור פרוץ I remain yours most truly

David Medola

of course you will let me know if you have been with Mr. H. and all that passed.

A who was this channel.

You certainly must excuse the writing interlines &c. the fog is so dense this morning—my sight far from the best and was determined to reply at once had I time I should transcribe it again

עלה
